CombinedTEA¶

class biosteam.CombinedTEA(TEAs, IRR)[source]¶

Create a CombinedTEA object that performs techno-economic analysis by using data from many TEA objects that correspond to different areas of a biorefinery. A CombinedTEA object serves to accomodate for areas of a biorefinery with different assumptions. For example, an area of a biorefinery may not operate the same days a year, may have different depreciation schedules, and may even be taxed differently than other areas. Ultimately, a CombinedTEA object is an aggregation of TEA objects that work together to conduct techno-economic analysis of a whole biorefinery.

Parameters

TEAs (Iterable[TEA]) – TEA objects used to conduct techno-economic analysis.

TEAs¶

Iterable[TEA] All TEA objects for cashflow calculation

property operating_days¶

[float] Number of operating days per year.

property utility_cost¶

Total utility cost (USD/yr).

property purchase_cost¶

Total purchase cost (USD).

property installation_cost¶

Total installation cost (USD).

property NPV¶

Net present value.

property DPI¶

Direct permanent investment.

property TDC¶

Total depreciable capital.

property FCI¶

Fixed capital investment.

property TCI¶

Total capital investment.

property FOC¶

Fixed operating costs (USD/yr).

property VOC¶

Variable operating costs (USD/yr).

property AOC¶

Annual operating cost excluding depreciation (USD/yr).

property material_cost¶

Annual material cost.

property annual_depreciation¶

Depreciation (USD/yr) equivalent to FCI dived by the the duration of the venture.

property sales¶

Annual sales revenue.

property net_earnings¶

Net earnings without accounting for annualized depreciation.

property ROI¶

Return on investment (1/yr) without accounting for annualized depreciation.

property PBP¶

Pay back period (yr) without accounting for annualized depreciation.

get_cashflow_table()[source]¶

Return DataFrame of the cash flow analysis.

production_cost(products, with_annual_depreciation=True)[source]¶

Return production cost of products [USD/yr].

Parameters

  • products (Iterable[Stream]) – Main products of the system

  • with_annual_depreciation=True (bool, optional) –

Notes

If there is more than one main product, The production cost is proportionally allocated to each of the main products with respect to their marketing values. The marketing value of each product is determined by the annual production multiplied by its selling price.

solve_IRR()[source]¶

Return the IRR at the break even point (NPV = 0) through cash flow analysis.

solve_price(stream, TEA=None)[source]¶

Return the price (USD/kg) of stream at the break even point (NPV = 0) through cash flow analysis.

Parameters

  • stream (Stream) – Stream with variable selling price.

  • TEA (TEA, optional) – Stream should belong here.

show()[source]¶

Prints information on unit.
